      • bootstrap

        public static void bootstrap()
        When under test internal classes have to be loaded in a very specific order. This function makes sure the server registers are initialized.

      • isShuttingDown

        public static boolean isShuttingDown()
        Gets whether the Minecraft server is currently in the process of shutting down. This method can be used to check whether the server is shutting down, or reloading, when plugins are disabled.
        Returns:
        True if the server is shutting down

        Returns:
        server tick counter

      • unsafeCast

        public static <T> T unsafeCast(java.lang.Object value)
        Performs an unsafe cast to a generic type. Be sure to check that the object being cast is actually an instance of the type to cast to. Casting errors will occur while working with the resulting value, not while performing the casting in this method.
        Parameters:
        value - to cast
        Returns:
        value cast in an unsafe way

      • syncTick

        public static void syncTick(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Executes a runnable on the main thread in the next tick. When this method is called from the main thread, the runnable is executed right away. This method blocks the calling thread until the runnable is successfully executed.
        Parameters:
        runnable - to execute on the main thread

      • nextTick

        public static void nextTick(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Schedules a runnable to execute the next Tick
        The BKCommonLib internal plugin will handle this task
        This method is thread safe
        Parameters:
        runnable - to execute

      • getPluginsUnsafe

        public static java.util.Collection<org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin> getPluginsUnsafe()
        Gets all Plugins running on the server WITHOUT allocating a new array if possible. If there is no performance requirement to avoid array allocation, use getPlugins() instead. Only use this method inside a synchronized body around the Plugin Manager, for example: 
         synchronized (Bukkit.getPluginManager()) {
        for (Plugin plugin : CommonUtil.getPluginsUnsafe()) {
                System.out.println(plugin.getName());
    }
 }
        Returns:
        unsafe collection of plugins running on the server

        Returns:
        Plugins

      • getClassConstants

        public static <T> T[] getClassConstants(java.lang.Class<T> theClass)
        Gets constants of the class type statically defined in the class itself. If the class is an enum, the enumeration constants are returned. Otherwise, only the static fields with theClass type are returned.
        Parameters:
        theClass - to get the class constants of
        Returns:
        class constants defined in class 'theClass'

      • getClassConstants

        public static <T> T[] getClassConstants(java.lang.Class<?> theClass,
                                        java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Gets constants of the class type statically defined in the class itself. If the type class is an enum, the enumeration constants are returned. Otherwise, only the static fields with the same type as the type parameter are returned.
        Parameters:
        theClass - to get the class constants of
        type - of constants to return from theClass
        Returns:
        class constants defined in class 'theClass'

        Returns:

      • getEventHandlerList

        public static org.bukkit.event.HandlerList getEventHandlerList(java.lang.Class<?> eventClass)
        Obtains the Handler List of an event, throwing an exception if this is not possible
        Parameters:
        eventClass - to get the HandlerList of
        Returns:
        the HandlerList
        Throws:
        RuntimeException: - Event class has no handler list

      • queueListenerLast

        public static void queueListenerLast(org.bukkit.event.Listener listener,
                                     java.lang.Class<?> eventClass)
        Re-orders the event registration to ensure that the listener MONITOR handler is called last, after all other listener handlers have executed. This should only be used if information is changed that could cause other listeners after this handler to malfunction.

        This method may fail if more than one Monitor handler per Event class is present in a single Listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - of the event handler
        eventClass - that is handled

      • queueListenerFirst

        public static void queueListenerFirst(org.bukkit.event.Listener listener,
                                      java.lang.Class<?> eventClass)
        Re-orders the event registration to ensure that the listener LOWEST handler is called first, before all other listener handlers have executed. This should only be used if information is changed that could cause other listeners before this handler to malfunction.
        This method may fail if more than one Lowest handler per Event class is present in a single Listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - of the event handler
        eventClass - that is handled

      • isMethodOverrided

        public static boolean isMethodOverrided(java.lang.Class<?> baseClass,
                                        java.lang.Object typeInstance,
                                        java.lang.String methodName,
                                        java.lang.Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Checks whether a certain method is overrided in a class
        Parameters:
        baseClass - the method is defined in
        typeInstance - to check whether it overrides in the base class
        methodName - of the method
        parameterTypes - of the method
        Returns:
        True if overrided, False if not

        Returns:

      • isMainThread

        public static boolean isMainThread()
        Gets whether the currently executing thread calling this method is the main server thread.
        Returns:
        True if this is the main thread
